business.headline: Dassault, Reliance Infrastructure to make Falcon 2000 business jets in IndiaDassault said it aims to deliver the first made-in-India jets by 2028 for corporate and military use, and will cater to rising demand in both Indian and international markets.
Sensex ends 138 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Titan down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 138.64 points to close at 81,444.66, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.35 points to end at 24,812.05.

IPO market heats up with Rs 26,000 crore fundraising in JuneA resurgence in initial public offerings is evident as several major companies plan to launch IPOs in June and July, raising substantial funds.

Explained: Why BSE shares are falling today The drop comes as the company announced a shift in the expiry day of its equity derivative contracts from Tuesdays to Thursdays, effective from September 1, after regulatory approval.

DLF's Rs 11,000 crore Privana North luxury project sells out in a weekSituated in the expansive 116-acre township in Gurugram, this project notched up sales beyond Rs 11,000 crore, highlighting the robust market appetite for premium homes in India's big cities.

Is buying a home in major Indian cities a mistake? Financial advisor explainsFinancial advisor Lovish Anand questions the wisdom of homeownership in high-cost Indian metros, highlighting the economic realities of renting versus buying.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares rose 6% todayOver the last year, IndusInd Bank's stock had fallen by 43.51%. However, it has shown signs of recovery in recent weeks, rising around 8.63% in the past month.

Middle class has eroded: Startup founder flags growing financial stress in IndiaOnce a marker of steady growth, India's middle class now faces rising costs, slower salary gains, and shifting financial priorities in an economy where old assumptions no longer hold true.
Sensex, Nifty rise as markets stay calm despite Iran-Israel flare-upThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 70.97 points to 81,654.27, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 44.50 points to 24,897.90 as of 9:28 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusOswal Pumps IPO allotment is set to be finalised on June 18, 2025, after a robust subscription. Investors can check their allotment status through BSE and Link Intime.

Indian stock market to open flat as Middle East tensions raise oil pricesAs of 8:23 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,852. This suggests that Nifty50 is likely to begin the day close to Tuesday's closing level of 24,853.4.

Stocks to watch on June 18: BSE, Delhivery, Bharat Forge, Vedanta, Ola ElectricAs investors wait to see how global events unfold, several stocks such as BSE, Delhivery, Bharat Forge, Vedanta, Ola Electric, are expected to remain in focus on Wednesday, June 18.

entertainment.headline: Hollywood superheroes inspired by Indian mythology: Akshay KumarActor Akshay Kumar, who will be seen in the upcoming mythological film 'Kannappa', said Hollywood superheroes and their superpowers are inspired by Indian mythology.

Ankit Siwach on Bahadur 120: Playing a soldier is a spiritual journeyActor Ankit Siwach opened up about his role in Farhan Akhtar's '120 Bahadur'. He mentioned how playing a soldier is like a dream come true for him.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office prediction: Will Aamir Khan be back to rule?Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is set to hit theatres on June 20. IndiaToday.in spoke to trade experts to gauge the pre-release buzz of the film, and understand its opening weekend performance prediction.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali says there was lot of love on Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam setsFilmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali talked about actors Salman Khan and Aishwarya Rai's chemistry in 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam'.  The film completed 26 years of release on June 18.

Samantha reacts to rumours of promoting Yeh Maaya Chesave ahead of re-releaseIn a recent interview, Samantha Ruth Prabhu addressed rumours about reuniting with ex-husband Naga Chaitanya to promote the re-release of their 2010 hit film, 'Yeh Maaya Chesave '.

Jonathan Bailey on choosing Jurrasic World: Struck a chord with the nerd in me'Bridgerton' actor Jonathan Bailey opened up about why he signed 'Jurassic World Rebirth'. He will portray Dr Henry Loomis in the upcoming actioner.

Add PM Modi quote, remove lotus: Censor board suggests 5 edits to Sitaare Zameen ParThe censor board on Monday reportedly passed 'Sitaare Zameen Par' with a U/A 13+ certificate. Here's the list of changes that the board recommended to the Aamir Khan starrer.

3 hits in 6 months: Why is Telugu cinema struggling at the box office?Telugu cinema may be basking in pan-India glory, but at home, the picture isn't as bright. With only three box office hits in the first half of 2025 and mounting pressure with every release, the industry finds itself at a crossroads, caught between global ambition and local disconnect.

Ex-NCT member Taeil pleads guilty to rape charges, prosecution seeks 7-year jailFormer NCT member Taeil has pleaded guilty to rape charges in a Seoul court. Prosecutors have sought a seven-year prison sentence and his removal from SM Entertainment.

Mannara Chopra breaks down at father's funeral, holds onto his bierActor Mannara Chopra's father, Raman Rai Handa, died earlier this week. At his funeral on Wednesday, daughters Mannara and Mitali were seen in tears as they bid an emotional final farewell to their father.

Aamir Khan seeks magic, not perfection: Sitaare Zameen Par director RS PrasannaIn an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, 'Sitaare Zameen Par' director RS Prasanna talked about Aamir Khan's 'perfectionist' tag. He also shared where Khan's brilliance lies as an artist who's constantly seeking cinematic magic.

Ronth review: Dileesh Pothan, Roshan Mathew drive this grim, layered cop dramaReleased-Fri Jun 13, 2025Ronth movie review: Written and directed by Shahi Kabir, this film is an intense cop drama about two patrolling officers on night duty that chronicles the events between the cops, citizens and the 'system'.

SRK begins filming intense jail action scene for King with 200 stuntmen: ReportShah Rukh Khan has started shooting a big action scene for 'King', set inside a foreign jail, with nearly 200 stunt performers involved. In the film, SRK plays a deadly assassin, and this powerful scene is an important part of the story.

Ram Charan gears up for grand train sequence for Peddi in Hyderabad: ReportRam Charan will be shooting a grand train fight sequence for 'Peddi' in Hyderabad, which is being touted as one of the biggest action moments in Indian cinema. Designed by top technicians, the scene is expected to be a major highlight of the film upon its release.

30 surrendered Naxalites attend special screening of Marathi film GhaathA special screening of the Marathi film 'Ghaath' was attended by 30 surrendered Naxalites along with their families in Maharashtra. The director and cast also interacted with them after the screening.

Salman Khan jokes about Aamir finding love at 60, tells Kapil he has his own leagueComedian Kapil Sharma asked Salman Khan to take inspiration from his friend and actor Aamir Khan, who is still searching for love at 60. The superstar gave a funny response and then burst into laughter.

Akshay Kumar shares update on Jolly LLB 3, says working with Arshad Warsi was funAfter 'Housefull 5', Akshay Kumar is now preparing for 'Jolly LLB 3', in which he reunites with Arshad Warsi. Directed by Subhash Kapoor, the film is inspired by real-life incidents, much like its predecessors.

Lot of people trolled me: Anupama Parameswaran on her break from Malayalam filmsActor Anupama Parameswaran recently opened up about her hiatus from Malayalam cinema. She shared that she chose to focus on meaningful films despite facing social media trolling over her acting skills.

Salman Khan takes a dig at Sikandar failure on The Great Indian Kapil Show. WatchIn the first promo for 'The Great Indian Kapil Show', superstar Salman Khan took a dig at the box office failure of his film 'Sikandar'. He joked on stage and then burst out laughing.

general news.headline: Iran says it won't surrender, warns Trump of irreparable harm if US intervenes Live UpdatesSupreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in a televised message, said Iran would stand firm against an 'imposed war' and rejected Trump's call for unconditional surrender.

Landed on soft soil, no blast on plane: How lone survivor escaped Air India crashTop sources informed India Today TV the reason behind his miraculous escape - Viswashkumar Ramesh landed in the narrow gap between two buildings where loose soil had been piled up, cushioning his fall and saving his life.

No trade deal talk or US mediation behind Pak truce: PM gets blunt with TrumpDonald Trump has repeatedly claimed that he mediated the ceasefire between India and Pakistan last month and the threat of cutting off trade forced the countries to stop the hostilities.

Bhupesh Baghel among flyers stranded after IndiGo flight door fails to openFormer Chhattisgarh Chief Minister and Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel was among the flyers stuck inside an IndiGo flight after its door failed to open for 30 minutes.

Fighting on Twitter? PM's joke with Macron, big laugh, Trump chatter onlineAt the G7 Summit, PM Narendra Modi told the French President, Emmanuel Macron, "Nowadays, you are fighting on Twitter," drawing laughter and setting off a viral wave online. Social media users quickly connected the remark to Macron's recent spat with US President Donald Trump.

What Mark Carney said on Nijjar killing after bilateral meet with PM ModiCanadian Prime Minister Mark Carney appeared cautious as he commented on discussions he had with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the June 2023 killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar in British Columbia.

Israel running low on air defence, missiles can last just 10-12 days: ReportIsraeli interceptors are under severe strain, with Arrow missiles costing $3 million each and defence operations reportedly burning through nearly $285 million a night, raising doubts over how long Israel can hold out.

Bengaluru couple travel to Goa to get married, he kills her thereA 22-year-old woman from Bengaluru was found murdered in a forest in South Goa. She had travelled to the coastal state with her boyfriend to get married, where a dispute reportedly led him to kill her.
June 18, the day Laxmi Bai, queen of Jhansi died and an icon of rebellion was bornRani Lakshmi Bai didn't just fight for Jhansi. She rewrote the meaning of rebellion.

Israel ramps up attack on Tehran after Khamenei's address, toll crosses 600As the Israel-Iran conflict entered its sixth day, Iran fired a Fattah-1 missile at Tel Aviv shortly after United States President Donald Trump demanded Tehran's 'unconditional surrender'.

'Triple jhatka', 'living in metaverse': BJP vs Congress over PM-Trump callAfter the telephonic conversation between PM Modi and US President Donald Trump, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh stressed that India has received 'triple jhatka' in foreign policy and diplomacy.

Sam Altman says Meta made big money move to steal OpenAI talent but failedOpenAI CEO Sam Altman publicly accused Meta of offering $100 million bonuses to poach staff, revealing details usually kept private in Silicon Valley's escalating race to hire top AI talent.

Vinotherapy, where you dip (not sip) into some wine for flawless skinWine is something that you probably swirl, sniff and then sip. But who knew it could be a part of a relaxing spa too - not as a drink, but as a luxurious ingredient in treatments like vinotherapy.

Only 2 Indian universities in top 50 in THE Impact Rankings 2025, 4 in top 100Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham and Lovely Professional University are the only two Indian institutions in the global top 50 of the Times Higher Education (THE) Impact Rankings 2025. Shoolini and JSS Academy also made the top 100.

Is Israel's Rising Lion a push for Iranians to rise up?Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's handwritten prayer at Jerusalem's Western Wall, "the people shall rise up as a lion", could be more than what meets the eye. The "people" may not be Israelis, but Iranians. Some analysts believe the line nods to Iran's own citizens, who are increasingly disillusioned with Khamenei's regime.

Government's new Rs 3000 FASTag pass for private vehicles: All you need to knowTo make highway travel simpler and more cost-effective for private vehicle owners, the Government of India has introduced a FASTag-based annual pass priced at Rs 3000. From activation to usage limits, here's everything you need to know.

Angry SpiceJet passengers force staff to eat biryani served to them, airline reactsSeveral SpiceJet passengers forced a staffer to eat biryani served to them after a flight was delayed. The airline later condemned the incident.

Viral video of Indian tourists performing Garba on Burj Khalifa sparks outrageThe viral video, shared by Dubai-based content creator The Walking Lens, shows Indian tourists dancing in a circle to the popular Gujarati song Chogada.

Honesty amid chaos: Man returns cash, jewellery found at Air India crash siteAmong the first responders after the Air India crash, Raju Patel helped in pulling out victims and also recovered jewellery and cash from the debris.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill will bat at No.4: Rishabh Pant confirms batting spot for India captainRishabh Pant has confirmed that India's new Test captain Shubman Gill will be batting at No.4 during the first Test against England, starting from June 20.

WTC winners South Africa get heroes' welcome as Bavuma leads homecomingSouth Africa's Test team returned home to a rousing heroes' welcome after their historic WTC Final win over Australia, with captain Temba Bavuma proudly leading the squad and holding the championship mace aloft.

Bethell vs Pope for No.3: Rob Key feels Headingley call won't define careersRob Key feels that the battle between Ollie Pope and Jacob Bethell for the No.3 spot for the Headingley Test won't end up defining their careers. Both men have staked a claim for the spot with their strong performances in recent times.

Rohit won't be missed as much as Kohli by Indian team: Geoffrey BoycottFormer England opener Geoffrey Boycott feels Rohit Sharma won't be missed as much as Virat Kohli in Test cricket. Boycott also explained why Kohli may have decided to retire from Test cricket ahead of the England tour.

Suryakumar Yadav travels to London for possible sports hernia surgeryIndia T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has flown to London for a medical consultation regarding a sports hernia. The injury may require surgery, which could impact his availability for India's upcoming T20I series in August.

Premier League: Manchester City name Bernardo Silva as new captainBernardo Silva has been named Manchester City captain ahead of the new season. Pep Guardiola decided to ditch the usual method and personally named Silva as the skipper and Rodri, Ruben Dias and Erling Haaland as the vice-captains.

Coach Gautam Gambhir joins India squad in Leeds ahead of first TestIndia's head coach Gautam Gambhir returned to the national squad in Leeds just in time for the first Test against England, bringing experience and direction back into the camp after briefly stepping away due to a family emergency.

Women's T20 World Cup 2026 schedule: IND vs PAK on June 14, final at Lord'sThe full schedule for the ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2026 has been unveiled, with the tournament set to take place across England and Wales. The competition will get underway on June 12 and will run for 24 days.

Emotional Umesh Yadav yearns for India comeback: I can't select myselfIndia fast bowler Umesh Yadav is yearning to make a comeback to the Indian team, having not played for the country for over two years. Umesh last played for India in the World Test Championship final against Australia.

Premier League 2025-26 fixtures: Manchester United face Arsenal in opening weekManchester United will host Arsenal in the first Super Sunday clash of the 2025/26 Premier League season, with Liverpool, Manchester City, Chelsea, and FA Cup winners Crystal Palace also playing on a bumper opening weekend.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
